Title:
On the Procompsognathus postcranium (Late Triassic,
Germany).
Keywords:
Dinosauria; Germany; Procompsognathus; Theropoda;
systematics; triassic
Abstract:
A review of the historical background of the material
housed in the Staatliches Museum f√ºr Naturkunde (Stuttgart) and ascribed
to Procompsognathus triassicus (Upper Triassic, Germany) is provided.
The systematic position of the postcranial remains is discussed. The
combined results of cladistic analyses suggest that the type material,
an incomplete postcranial skeleton in two pieces (SMNS 12591), is from a
theropod close to Segisaurus and Coelophysis. An isolated manus (SMNS
12352a) is definitely not theropodan, but could be from any small basal
archosaur. The remarkable diversity of the carnivorous guild that
dwelled in southern Germany before the end-Triassic events is
underlined.
